title: Best Black Friday cycling deals 2024: Savings on bikes, kit and parts
content:
Cyclist
Best Black Friday cycling deals 2024: Savings on bikes, kit and parts

Black Friday is back, and you know what that means: bargains. Cycling is an expensive hobby to say the least, so it’s always a good time of year to not only scoop discounted products for Christmas but also to replenish your kit and maybe even get a new bike.

Below we’ve collated the best Black Friday cycling deals we’ve seen from British retailers including bikes, components, clothing and tools.

Best Black Friday cycling deals UK

Bikes

  • Specialized S-Works Aethos frameset – save 40%
  • Cannondale Topstone Carbon 3 – save 41%
  • Specialized Tarmac SL7 Sport (105) – save 38%
  • Specialized Tarmac SL7 Comp (105 Di2) – save 34%
  • Giant Propel Advanced SL 1 – save 33%
  • Cannondale SuperSix Evo 3 – save 33%
  • Specialized Roubaix SL8 Comp – save 29%
  • Specialized Tarmac SL8 Expert – save 25%

Clothing

  • Le Col Pro Aqua Zero Long Sleeve Jersey – save 44%
  • Castelli Arenberg Gel 2 cycling mitts – save 45%
  • Endura Pro SL Lite windproof gilet – save 45%
  • Castelli Velocissimo 5 Bib Tights – save 50%
  • Bontrager XXX Carbon SPD-R road cycling shoes – save 50%
  • Fizik Vento Stabilita road cycling shoes – save 47%
  • Specialized S-Works Evade 3 helmet – save 40%
  • Castelli Perfetto RoS 2/RoS 2 Convertible jacket – save 35%
  • Le Col Pro Bib Shorts – save 52%
  • Quoc Gran Tourer XC gravel shoes – save 37%
  • Oakley Sutro Lite sunglasses – save 36%
  • 100% Aerocraft sunglasses – save 21%

Components

  • Pirelli P Zero Race TLR – save 40%
  • Mavic Cosmic SL 45 – save 37%
  • Roval Alpiniste CLX II Disc carbon wheelset – save 41%
  • Campagnolo Bora Ultra WTO wheelset – save up to 46%
  • Hunt 54 Aerodynamicist Carbon Disc Wheelset – save 36%
  • Specialized S-Works Power Mirror Saddle – save 25%
  • Vittoria Corsa N.ext tubeless tyre – save 42%
  • Pirelli P Zero Smartube – save 26%

Accessories

  • Garmin Edge 530 Cycling Computer – save 27%
  • Exposure Trace and TraceR Mk3 light set – save 20%
  • Lezyne Micro Drive Pro 1000+ front light – save 25%
  • Hammerhead heart rate monitor – save 30%
  • Elite Direto XR-T smart trainer – save 47%
  • Wattbike Proton starter pack – save 20%

Maintenance

  • Birzman Torque Driver – save 32%
  • Topeak Tubi 18 Multi Tool – save 55%
  • Tredz Mini Cleaning kit – save 52%
  • Tredz Chain Wear Indicator – save 43%
  • Topeak Joe Blow Sport III floor pump – save 20%
  • Muc-Off Nano Tech Bike Cleaner – save 34%
  • Silca Ultimate Tubeless Sealant – save 50%

The best Black Friday cycling deals so far

Specialized S-Works Aethos frameset – save 40%

Was £5,000, now £2,999 | View offer

Okay so we’re starting with not a full bike and you’ll still have to get the parts to build it up if you don’t already have them, but the S-Works Aethos is one of the most celebrated bikes to come out of Specialized in the last few years and a 56 weighs just 588g. Sounds like a good time to get preparing for next year’s hill climb season.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£2,999)

Cannondale Topstone Carbon 3 – save 41%

Was £3,200, now £1,899 | View offer

For those after a gravel bike, Sigma Sports is offering over 40% off the 2025 Cannondale Topstone Carbon 3, which features the Kingpin rear suspension system to help smooth out rough ground. It’s built with a Shimano GRX 820 12-speed groupest with WTB wheels and is compatible with a 27.2mm dropper post.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£1,899)

Specialized Tarmac SL7 Sport (105) – save 38%

Was £3,250, now £1,999 | View offer

While Specialized has moved on to the SL8, there are still plenty of deals to be had on the popular SL7. The Sport version has a Shimano 105 groupset with DT Swiss R470 wheels and 26mm Specialized Turbo Pro tyres.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£1,999)

Specialized Tarmac SL7 Comp (105 Di2) – save 34%

Was £4,250, now £2,799 | View offer

If you’re wanting a bit more than the SL7 Sport, the SL7 Comp comes with the Shimano 105 Di2 electronic groupset with the same everything else.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£2,799)

Giant Propel Advanced SL 1 – save 33%

Was £8,999, now £5,999 | View offer

Over at Tredz, you can go much higher-end with the Giant Propel aero road bike, as ridden by the Jayco-AlUla team. This sale model comes with Shimano Ultegra Di2, just one step off the top spec.

It’s all carbon everywhere and comes with deep Cadex 50 rims and 25mm Cadex aero tyres.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£5,999)

Cannondale SuperSix Evo 3 – save 33%

Was £4,000, now £2,699 | View offer

This Cannondale SuperSix Evo road bike has pretty much the same spec as the Specialized Tarmac SL7 Comp with the 105 Di2 groupset and DT Swiss R470 wheels but obviously on a different frame and it’s a little bit cheaper. It also has slightly narrower tyres with 25mm Vittoria Rubino Pros.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£2,699)

Specialized Roubaix SL8 Comp – save 29%

Was £4,250, now £2,999 | View offer

For a more comfort-oriented ride, Sigma also has Specialized’s Roubaix SL Comp on offer, which again comes with 105 Di2 but comes with 32mm S-Works Mondo tyres, is fitted with a Future Shock handlebar suspension system to ease your wrists over uneven surfaces. It’s part of the latest generation of endurance road bikes that can be taken on light off-road tracks without a problem – or just ride in much more comfort on the road.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£2,999)

Specialized Tarmac SL8 Expert – save 25%

Was £5,500, now £4,125 | View offer

Balfe’s Bikes has a Black Friday discount on the latest Tarmac, the SL8. This Expert version has a SRAM Rival AXS electronic groupset with a power meter included and a 12-speed cassette as well as 26mm S-Works Turbo tyres on Roval C38 carbon wheels.

  • Buy it now from Balfe’s Bikes (£4,125)

Le Col Pro Aqua Zero Long Sleeve Jersey – save 44%

Was £170, now £95.20 | View offer

Le Col has big discounts across a range of its clothing, with its Extra20 code adding to its already discounted prices. The Pro Aqua Zero jersey is a great option for cool, damp rides, with its surface coating helping to repel water and an insulated fabric, with a race fit.

  • Buy it now from Le Col (£95.20)

Castelli Arenberg Gel 2 cycling mitts – save 45%

Were £49.00, now £26.95 | View offer

With the Paris-Roubaix inspired name, we reckon that Castelli has prioritised vibration absorption with its Arenberg Gel mitts. There’s a mix of gel padding for comfort and silicone for grip, with a mesh backing to keep your hands cool. White may not be the best colour for riding the cobbles, but Tredz also has the black, grey and red options at the same price.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£26.95)

Endura Pro SL Lite windproof gilet – save 45%

Was £109.99, now £54.99 | View offer

Add some cold and wet weather protection for your ride with Endura’s high spec gilet. It’s windproof at the front and there’s a water resistant lower rear panel with pockets, while further up the rear is mesh to help keep you less sweaty. There’s a decent range of sizes and colours available at Cyclestore, including hi viz yellow to supplement the front and rear reflective logos.

  • Buy it now from Cyclestore (£55.99)

Castelli Velocissimo 5 Bib Tights – save 50%

Was £135, now £67.50 | View offer

Castelli’s winter tights feature Nano Flex fabric below the knee to help keep out wheel spray, with Thermo Flex above the knee for insulation, which leads to a 204g claimed weight in size M. There’s Castelli’s well-regarded, less bulky Kiss Air2 seat pad, mesh straps and zip-free ankles for a more comfortable fit.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£67.50)

Bontrager XXX Carbon SPD-R road cycling shoes – save 50%

Was £349, now £175 | View offer

Onto the clothing now and at Balfe’s you can get 50% off these high-end Bontrager shoes in black. Worn by the pros, they have stiff and lightweight carbon soles, an ergonomic fit, a lightweight and breathable upper, and a dual Boa dial closure system.

This is great value.

  • Buy it now from Balfe’s Bikes (£175)

Fizik Vento Stabilita road cycling shoes – save 47%

Was £374.99, now £199.99 | View offer

Another big shoe bargain, this time from Tredz. These Fizik shoes are similarly high-end with similar features including a stiff carbon sole and they’re similarly discounted, but importantly, they come in white (though you can choose between those, a silver pair and a black pair).

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£199.99)

Specialized S-Works Evade 3 helmet – save 40%

Was £250, now £149.99 | View offer

Specialized’s current aero road helmet, the Evade 3 is slippery, well ventilated and comfortable. You’ll have likely seen it on the heads of riders including Remco Evenepoel, Primož Roglič and Demi Vollering.

It gets the stamp of approval from Cyclist too.

  • Buy it now from Balfe’s Bikes (£149.99)

Castelli Perfetto RoS 2 jacket – save 35%

Was £260, now £169.99 | View offer

Just in time for bad weather, you can save big on the Castelli Perfetto RoS 2 jacket, which was developed as the long sleeve Gabba. It has a race fit and is built with Gore-Tex Infinium Windstopper fabric for water and wind resistance and a light and breathable feel.

Alternatively, for an extra £10, depending on size and colour, you can upgrade to the RoS 2 Convertible and get both a short sleeved and a long sleeved option.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£169.99)

Le Col Pro Bib Shorts – save 52%

Was £185, now £88.80 | View offer

Another Le Col item with a deep discount, the Pro summer bib shorts include a quality seat pad with memory foam inserts in a lightweight, compressive lower section with low profile mesh straps. Le Col claims aero optimisation too. There are four short/bib colour options and sizes from XS to 3XL available. Le Col has Black Friday discounts on its other shorts and tights too.

  • Buy it now from Le Col (£88.80)

Quoc Gran Tourer XC gravel shoes – save 37%

Was £240, now £151 | View offer

Trendy shoe brand Quoc’s gravel shoes are available with a discount at Sigma Sports. They incorporate a carbon sole and TPU treads, with removeable spikes for extra grip. The dual dial closure ensures comfort without pressure points and there’s a vibration-absorbing insole. The shoes are available in grey in most sizes and also in the slightly less practical pink with a 10% discount.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£151)

Oakley Sutro Lite sunglasses – save up to 36%

Were £168, now from £108 | View offer

Get the pro look with the popular Sutro Lite glasses from Oakley. The catch is that there are limited numbers available at this price, although other lens/frame colour combos are also discounted. Tredz also has a discount on the full-frame Sutro, smaller format Sutro S and other Oakley styles too.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (from £108)

100% Aerocraft sunglasses – save 21%

Was £175, now £139.99 | View offer

100%’s pro-level sunnies cut a dash and offer great performance, thanks to their interchangeable HiPer lenses. There’s a range of lens and frame colours available for the Aerocraft, but Tweeks Cycles has other 100% glasses on offer, including the S3, if the Aerocraft aren’t your style.

  • Buy it now from Tweeks Cycles (£139.99)

Pirelli P Zero Race TLR – save 40%

Was £66.99, now £39.99 | View offer

When an individual tyre costs over £60, an almost half price deal is not to be sniffed at. Tredz have 26mm Pirelli P Zero Race tubeless-ready tyres in its Black Friday sale. They’re top tier tyres used by Pirelli’s sponsored pro teams so have durability, puncture protection, grip in wet and dry conditions and low rolling resistance.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£39.99)

Mavic Cosmic SL 45 Disc – save 37%

Was £1,420, now £899.99 | View offer

Obviously you’ll need some wheels too, and these aero carbon wheels from Mavic are great value. They’ have 45mm deep rims, so they’re aero, lightweight and stiff, so unless you’re doing hill climbs they’ll be good for any kind of roads you’re riding.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£899.99)

Roval Alpiniste CLX II Disc carbon wheelset – save 41%

Was £2,500, now £1,465.00 | View offer

Roval’s climbing wheels have a claimed 1,264g wheelset weight with a 33mm rim depth. Their 21mm internal rim width is designed for tyres from 24mm to 38mm wide, while they use DT Swiss hub internals including the top spec 180 EXP freehub with 36 points of engagement. The catch is that you’re going to have to wait until end-January for delivery – but you weren’t going to ride your flashy new wheels on British winter roads, were you?

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£1,465)

Campagnolo Bora Ultra WTO wheelset – save up to 46%

Was £2,818, now from £1,521.70 | View offer

Available with both Shimano and XDR freehub, as well as Campagnolo, although with slightly less of a discount, the Bora Ultra WTO wheelset has a claimed 1,385g weight and CULT ceramic bearings. The 21mm internal rim is tubeless-ready, with Campagnolo’s 2-Way Fit system avoiding the need to add rim tape, saving yet more weight.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£1,521.70)

Hunt 54 Aerodynamicist Carbon Disc Wheelset – save 36%

Was £1,009, now £699 | View offer

Our final set of wheels comes from British brand Hunt. Now Hunt has deals on loads of its celebrated wheelsets, but we’ve picked this one out as it’s the biggest bargain.

These carbon wheels have 54mm deep rims for aero gains and weigh only 1,524g, adding a touch more weight than its more pricy sibling the 54 UD Carbon Spoke Disc, which has carbon spokes as opposed to the steel ones here.

P.S. Hunt is offering an extra 10% off that price if you use code BF-EXTRA10

  • Buy it now from Hunt (£699)

Specialized S-Works Power Mirror Saddle – save 25%

Was £350, now £262.50 | View offer

3D printed saddles have taken over at the top end of the market, promising increased comfort through better weight distribution and improved air circulation. Specialized’s top of the range S-Works saddle is super-light, weighing just 190g in 143mm width. If you find the price a bit steep, Cyclestore has other, more affordable Specialized Mirror saddles discounted too.

  • Buy it now from Cyclestore (£262.50)

Vittoria Corsa N.ext tubeless tyre – save 42%

Was £69.99, now £39.95 | View offer

The Corsa N.ext brings Vittoria’s graphene tyres down to a more affordable price, thanks to its nylon casing in place of cotton. The tyre is tubeless-ready and Vittoria also claims increased durability, making the Corsa N.ext a good option for training. It’s available in sizes from 24mm all the way up to 34mm, so there’s an option to suit any bike.

  • Buy it now from Cyclestore (£39.95)

Pirelli P Zero Smartube – save 26%

Was from £29.99, now from £22.49 | View offer

TPU inner tubes are a go-to addition to your bike, saving you weight and rolling resistance. If you’ve gone tubeless, they’re much lighter and more compact than a standard tube, making a TPU tube a good option to carry as a spare. Pirelli’s P Zero Smartubes will fit tyres from 23mm to 32mm and they’re available from Tweeks with 42mm, 60mm or 80mm valves. There’s a discount on the Cinturato gravel option as well.

  • Buy it now from Tweeks Cycles (from £22.49)

Garmin Edge 530 Cycling Computer – save 27%

Was £260, now £189 | View offer

Don’t discount Garmin’s previous generation Edge 530. It does pretty much everything you need to log your rides and track your performance, with the back end Garmin Connect app providing in-depth insights and a repository for your record history. There’s navigation and live tracking built in, among a host of other features to help you get the best out of your rides.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£189)

Exposure Trace and TraceR Mk3 light set – save 20%

Was £94.99, now £76 | View offer

Exposure’s tiny lights pack a punch, with high brightness, long run times and good all-round visibility. They’re really well made too and we’ve had lights that are still going strong after years of use. Tweeks has other Exposure lights on offer if you’re looking for something with more output.

  • Buy it now from Tweeks Cycles (£76)

Lezyne Micro Drive Pro 1000+ front light – save 25%

Was £75, now £55.99 | View offer

If you want enough light for riding on unlit roads, the Lezyne Micro Drive 1000+ is a good option. You’ll have guessed it speak output, which it can deliver for a claimed 1.5 hours. It’s compact too, so it’s not going to swamp your bars and its 168g weight won’t weigh you down either. Choose one of the three lower constant settings and runtimes extend out to 11 hours, while the three flashing settings give you up to 60 hours runtime.

  • Buy it now from Tweeks Cycles (£55.99)

Hammerhead Heart Rate Monitor – save 30%

Was £64, now £45 | View offer

Alongside its cycling computer, Hammerhead has its own heart rate monitor. Broadcasting over ANT+ and two Bluetooth channels, it can be hooked up to a range of devices, not just the Hammerhead Karoo, to give you accurate heart rate measurement as you’re riding or working out. Battery life from the CR2023 coin cell is claimed at over 900 hours.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£45.00)

Elite Direto XR-T smart trainer – save 47%

Was £829.99, now £439 | View offer

The Direto is Elite’s flagship smart trainer, with resistance of 3,600 watts and gradient simulation of up to 24%. The design is compact when stored, but the legs fold out for a stable platform once in use. There’s no cassette supplied with this model, but it’s compatible with a wide range of options and the freehub can be swapped out for an optional XDR or Campagnolo one if you prefer. With +/-1.5% power accuracy, it’s up there with the best.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£439)

Wattbike Proton starter pack – save 20%

Was £2,050, now £1,645 | View offer

Wattbike has its range of trainers available with a Black Friday discount. The Proton is a compact unit that’s well regarded, with easy set-up and adjustment. This starter pack includes the Proton with a £150 discount, as well as a Polar HRM strap, free assembly, a 12 month subscription to the Wattbike Hub and one month’s Zwift membership.

  • Buy it now from Wattbike (£1,645)

Birzman Torque Driver – save 32%

Was £19.99, now £13.49 | View offer

Almost every bolt on your bike needs to be tightened to a specified torque. A torque key is a lot cheaper than an adjustable torque wrench, but will make sure that you don’t over-tighten your bolts. This Birzman torque driver is available with 4Nm or the more commonly used 5Nm fixed settings and comes with a range of hex bits as well as a Torx T25, to fettle the most common bolts on your bike.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£13.49)

Topeak Tubi 18 Multi Tool – save 55%

Was £42.99, now £19.95 | View offer

With tubeless comes a range of new tools required to get you moving if you get a flat. Topeak’s multi tool includes a blade, a reamer and a plug inserter alongside the normal collection of hex and Torx heads. There’s an integrated box to keep your tyre plugs from going astray as well.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£19.35)

Tredz Mini Cleaning kit – save 52%

Was £20.99, now £9.99 | View offer

This kit from Tredz includes cleaner, degreaser, lube and a sponge for a tenner. Nice.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£9.99)

Tredz Chain Wear Indicator – save 43%

Was £6.99, now £3.99 | View offer

Everyone needs a chain wear checker, this one’s £4. In this day and age, take the savings you can get – though it’ll be a better deal if you buy something else too as you need to spend £30 at Tredz to get free delivery.

  • Buy it now from Tredz (£3.99)

Topeak Joe Blow Sport III floor pump – save 20%

Was £46.99, now £37.60 | View offer

There’s not a huge Black Friday discount on this Topeak pump, but it’s probably the last one you’ll ever need to buy. The steel base and barrel mean it’s ultra-sturdy and easy to use, there’s a good length of hose with a lock-on presta/schrader head and there are even adapters to inflate balls and air mattresses. A quality gauge helps you to dial in the right tyre pressure. We’ve been using one for years without issue and you can buy spare parts if you need them.

  • Buy it now from Tweeks Cycles (£37.60)

Muc-Off Nano Tech Bike Cleaner – save 34%

Was £11.99, now £7.99 | View offer

Winter bike cleaning is a necessary chore, but it can be made a lot quicker and easier with a quality bike cleaner. Muc-Off’s cleaner is highly effective – just spray it on, leave for a few minutes and wash off and it should get rid of most of the muck your bike has accumulated on a damp winter ride. It’s biodegradable ad shouldn’t damage your bike’s sels and components.

  • Buy it now from Tweeks Cycles (£7.99)

Silca Ultimate Tubeless Sealant – save 50%

Was £42 now £21 | View offer

Who doesn’t love an extra slosh of sealant in their tyres? Silca’s is smarter then most, as it contains chopped, recycled carbon fibre. That makes it more difficult to set up, but provides a robust, quick seal should you get a puncture. All sealant dries out over time, but Silca’s system allows you to top up the latex carrier through your valve with its Replenisher, so you save on maintenance longer term.

  • Buy it now from Sigma Sports (£21)
